title: Teacher Orchestration Load Management Strategies in CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of cooperative learning principles and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: CSCL-based project implementation in a microlearning environment to enhance social sector job competencies.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more components (cognitive/physical effort) of teacher orchestration load occurring in CSCL environments.
Learners can compare two types of CSCL tools (fixed vs. flexible) and apply their respective strengths and weaknesses to work scenarios.
Learners can design load measurement strategies utilizing three data sources (observational behavior/physiological metrics/self-reports) of the teacher orchestration framework.
Learners can analyze real-world vocational training institution cases and write evaluation reports on the correlation between tool flexibility and workload intensity.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
